p: The leaves were randomly collected from B. balsamifera cultivated in planting base (the planting base belongs to Gui Zhou Ai Yuan Eco-Pharmaceutical Development Co. Ltd) in Luodian County (Southwest China, 25° 04′ N; 106° 28′ E), and the samples were collected once a month from September 2016 to February 2017. The plant was identified by Prof. Y.N. He (Institute of Biotechnology, Guizhou Academy of Agricultural Sciences, China), and a voucher specimen (CGA-Dafengai-Guizhou-2009-11) was deposited in the Institute of Biotechnology, Guizhou Academy of Agricultural Sciences. The leaves were air-dried in the room and then were milled into 80 mesh powder before hydrodistillation.
